bio: Rajesh is a master of traditional Indian cuisine, with a focus on recipes from the northern region.

cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for a few hours.
Roast chicken in oven until partly cooked.
Simmer tomato sauce with cream and garam masala.
Add chicken to the sauce and cook until heated through.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.
Saute onion, garlic, and ginger in a pot.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
Puree spinach mixture in a blender.
Add diced paneer cheese to the pot and cook until lightly browned.
Add spinach puree and more spices, and cook until heated through.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.
Soak chickpeas overnight.
Boil chickpeas in a pot until tender.
Saute onion, garlic, and ginger in a pot.
Add cooked chickpeas and more spices, and cook until heated through.
Make dough from flour and water, and roll into balls.
Deep-fry dough balls until puffed and lightly browned.
Serve hot with chickpeas.

bio: Priya is an expert in South Indian cuisine, with a focus on vegetarian and seafood dishes.

cooking_method: Soak rice and dal overnight.
Grind rice and dal into batter.
Ferment batter for several hours.
Saute diced potatoes, onion, and tomatoes in a pan.
Spread batter thinly on a griddle.
Add potato mixture to the center of the dosa.
Roll dosa around
Serve hot with chutney and sambar.
Saute onion, garlic, and ginger in a pot.
Add diced fish and more spices, and cook until lightly browned.
Add coconut milk and simmer until fish is cooked through.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
Cook toor dal until tender.
Add diced vegetables and more spices, and cook until tender.
Add tamarind and simmer until flavors are combined.
Serve hot with rice or bread.

bio: Amit is a creative chef who combines traditional Indian flavors with global influences.

cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for a few hours.
Roast chicken in a tandoor oven until fully cooked.
Serve hot with mint chutney and naan bread.
Saute onion, garlic, and ginger in a pot.
Add diced mutton and more spices, and cook until lightly browned.
Add tomato sauce and yogurt, and simmer until meat is tender.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
Boil potatoes and peas until tender.
Saute onion and tomatoes in a pan.
Add boiled vegetables and spices, and cook until mashed.
Serve hot with pav bread and onion salad.

bio: Sanjeev is one of India's most popular and respected chefs, known for his innovative take on traditional Indian cuisine.

cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for a few hours.
Roast chicken in a tandoor oven until lightly browned.
Saute tomato puree and spices in a pan.
Add roasted chicken, cream, and butter, and simmer until fully cooked.
Serve hot with rice or naan bread.
Saute onion and tomatoes in a pan.
Add spinach and spices, and cook until wilted.
Blend mixture to a smooth puree.
Saute paneer cubes in a separate pan until golden brown.
Add puree and paneer to a pot and simmer until flavors are combined.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
Soak chickpeas overnight and cook until tender.
Saute onion and tomatoes in a pan.
Add cooked chickpeas and spices, and cook until flavors are combined.
Make a dough with maida flour and water, and roll into small rounds.
Deep fry rounds until fully cooked.
Serve hot with chickpeas and onion salad.

bio: Saransh is a young and dynamic chef who is known for his innovative approach to Indian cuisine.

cooking_method: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for a few hours.
Roast chicken in a tandoor oven until lightly browned.
Saute tomato puree and spices in a pan.
Add roasted chicken, cream, and butter, and simmer until fully cooked.
Cook basmati rice separately.
Layer rice and chicken mixture in a pot and cook until flavors are combined.
Serve hot with raita and papad.
Saute onion and tomatoes in a pan.
Add ground lamb and spices, and cook until browned.
Add peas and more spices, and cook until tender.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
Mix milk powder, flour, and a little water to make a dough.
Make small balls and fry them until golden brown.
Make sugar syrup with sugar, cardamom, and water.
Soak fried balls in sugar syrup for a few hours.
Serve hot or cold.

bio: Atul is a Michelin-starred chef who is known for his culinary expertise in both Indian and British cuisine.

cooking_method: Marinate lamb in yogurt and spices for a few hours.
Saute onion and spices in a pan.
Add marinated lamb and cook until browned.
Add tomato puree and cook until lamb is fully cooked.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
Blend mango, yogurt, sugar, and cardamom in a blender.
Add ice and blend until smooth.
Serve cold in glasses.
Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for a few hours.
Roast chicken in a tandoor oven until lightly browned.
Saute onion and spices in a pan.
Add tomato puree and cook until fully cooked.
Add roasted chicken, cream, and more spices, and simmer until fully cooked.
Serve hot with rice or bread.
